qas.question: Which Sun reporter was found guilty in 2015?
Who was responsible for Operation Elveden?
How much did Anthony France pay to a police officer?
Who was the policeman leading Operation Elveden?
How did Briggs characterize the relationship between France and Edwards?

context: On 22 May 2015, Sun reporter <a0_0><a1_0>Anthony France<a1_0/><a0_0/> was found guilty of aiding and abetting misconduct in a public office between 2008 and 2011. France’s trial followed the <a2_0>London Metropolitan Police<a2_0/>'s Operation Elveden, an ongoing investigation into alleged payments to police and officials in exchange for information. He had paid a total of <a3_0>more than £22,000<a3_0/> to PC Timothy Edwards, an anti-terrorism police officer based at Heathrow Airport. The police officer had already pleaded guilty to misconduct in a public office and given a two-year gaol sentence in 2014, but the jury in France’s trial was not informed of this. Following the passing of the guilty verdict, the officer leading Operation Elveden, <a4_0>Detective Chief Superintendent Gordon Briggs<a4_0/> said France and Edwards had been in a <a5_0>"long-term, corrupt relationship"<a5_0/>.
